meanings.definition: A series of short parallel lines used in map drawing to indicate relief.
meanings.sent1: The map legend explained that the hachure lines represented mountains.
meanings.sent2: The cartographer carefully added hachure marks to show the elevation changes.
meanings.sent3: The hachure lines on the map looked like tiny ladders climbing up the page.
meanings.sent4: The hachure lines crisscrossed like a web of secrets on the map.
meanings.sent5: The hachure lines made the landscape pop out, like a 3D picture.

meanings.definition: To mark with or as if with hachures.
meanings.sent1: She hachured the drawing to give it a sense of depth.
meanings.sent2: The artist hachured the sketch to show the shading.
meanings.sent3: He hachured the map with precision, making it look more realistic.
meanings.sent4: The architect hachured the plans, adding detail to the design.
meanings.sent5: Hachuring the image made it come alive, like magic on paper.
